abstract.para: Kyuuba is an init programme for POSIX-ish systems, that is intended to replace the current de-facto standard SysV-style and BSD-style init programmes.

Design goals include complete independence of shell scripts, speed, small memory and on-disk footprints, portability (it should run on at least Linux, *BSD, Darwin and all applicable parts should run on Windows), flexibility and it should aid in virtualisation and service jailing.
